definitions.definition: An argot, the jargon of a particular class or subgroup.
definitions.example: He had the look of a prince, but the cant of a fishmonger.

definitions.definition: A private or secret language used by a religious sect, gang, or other group.
A language spoken by some Irish Travellers; Shelta.
Empty, hypocritical talk.
definitions.example: People claim to care about the poor of Africa, but it is largely cant.

definitions.definition: Whining speech, such as that used by beggars.
A blazon of a coat of arms that makes a pun upon the name (or, less often, some attribute or function) of the bearer, canting arms.
A call for bidders at a public fair; an auction.
To speak with the jargon of a class or subgroup.
To speak in set phrases.
To preach in a singsong fashion, especially in a false or empty manner.
Of a blazon, to make a pun that references the bearer of a coat of arms.
To sell by auction, or bid at an auction.
Side, edge, corner, niche.
definitions.example: Under the cant of a hill.

definitions.definition: Slope, the angle at which something is set.
A corner (of a building).
An outer or external angle.
An inclination from a horizontal or vertical line; a slope or bevel; a tilt.
A movement or throw that overturns something.
A sudden thrust, push, kick, or other impulse, producing a bias or change of direction; also, the bias or turn so given.
definitions.example: to give a ball a cant

definitions.definition: (coopering) A segment forming a side piece in the head of a cask.
A segment of the rim of a wooden cogwheel.
A piece of wood laid upon the deck of a vessel to support the bulkheads.
To set (something) at an angle.
definitions.example: to cant a cask; to cant a ship

definitions.definition: To give a sudden turn or new direction to.
definitions.example: to cant round a stick of timber; to cant a football

definitions.definition: To bevel an edge or corner.
To overturn so that the contents are emptied.
A parcel, a division.
To divide or parcel out.
Lively, lusty.
